alert.note: Alert for Iron; Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 01 at 8:19AM MST until January 01 at 2:15PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Iron County in southern Utah... West Central Kane County in southern Utah... East Central Washington County in southwestern Utah... * Until 215 PM MST. * At 819 AM MST, Park rangers at Zion National Park reported heavy rain across the warned area causing several canyons around the park to flood. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Park rangers reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and canyons as well as streets, underpasses, and other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
